title: 108_hr1169
content: SECTION 1. QUALIFIED TAX COLLECTION CONTRACTS. Subchapter A of chapter 64 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding a new section, SEC. 6306, regarding qualified tax collection contracts. The Secretary can enter into a qualified tax collection contract, which involves hiring a person to contact specified taxpayers for payment of federal taxes and to obtain financial information, while ensuring compliance with IRS regulations. The Secretary can retain up to 25% of fees collected under a qualified tax collection contract for service costs. The United States is not liable for any actions of individuals under the contract. Cross references include damages for unauthorized collection actions and application of Taxpayer Assistance Orders. The Secretary can retain up to 25% of fees collected under a qualified tax collection contract for service costs. Conforming amendments are made to sections 7809(a) and the table of sections for subchapter A of chapter 64 of the Code. Sec. 7433A introduces civil damages for unauthorized collection actions under qualified tax collection contracts. Section 7433 applies to individuals working under qualified tax collection contracts as if they were IRS employees. Any civil action must be brought against the contract holder, not the US government, and the contract holder is liable for damages and costs. This civil action is not the exclusive remedy against the contract holder. Section 7433 does not apply to individuals under qualified tax collection contracts. The table of sections for subchapter B of chapter 76 is amended accordingly. Section 7433A introduces civil damages for unauthorized collection actions by individuals under qualified tax collection contracts. Additionally, Section 7811 of the Code is amended to include provisions for taxpayer assistance orders issued to persons performing services under such contracts. Section 1203 of the Internal Revenue Service Restructuring Act of 1998 is amended to include a provision that individuals performing services under a qualified tax collection contract will cease to be permitted if there is a final determination of misconduct by the Secretary of the Treasury. The amendments to Section 1203 of the Internal Revenue Service Restructuring Act of 1998 will take effect on the date of the enactment of this Act.
